translations.chinese: 轅生說漢王曰：「漢與楚相距滎陽數歲，漢常困。
translations.english: Guan Sheng advised King Han: "Han and Chu have confronted each other at Xingyang for several years. Han has often been in difficulty.

translations.chinese: 願君 王出武關，項王必引兵南走，王深壁，令滎陽成皋間且得休息。
translations.english: I hope your majesty will go out through Wuguan. Xiang Yu will certainly lead troops south. Your majesty should fortify deeply and let the area between Xingyang and Chenggao get some rest.

translations.chinese: 使韓信等得輯河北趙地，連燕齊，君王乃復走滎陽。
translations.english: Let Han Xin and others consolidate the lands north of the Yellow River in Zhao, connecting Yan and Qi. Your majesty can then return to Xingyang.

translations.chinese: 如此，則楚所備者多，力分。
translations.english: In this way, Chu will have many places to defend, and their strength will be divided.

translations.chinese: 漢得休息，復與之 戰，破之必矣。」
translations.english: Han will get rest, then fight them again. Defeating them will certainly be possible."
